facts.text: D.C. United won the first MLS Cup on October 20, 1996, defeating Los Angeles Galaxy with a score of 3-2 after extra time.
The 2002 MLS Cup final, held on October 20, saw Los Angeles Galaxy win their first MLS Cup by defeating New England Revolution 1-0 after extra time.
The 2006 MLS Cup was decided by a penalty shootout, with Houston Dynamo defeating New England Revolution 4-3 on penalties after a 1-1 draw in extra time.
The highest attendance for an MLS Cup final was 73,019 at the 2018 match between Atlanta United FC and Portland Timbers held at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Georgia.
Toronto FC won the MLS Cup on December 9, 2017, achieving a domestic treble by also winning the Supporters' Shield and the Canadian Championship in the same year.
The 2020 MLS Cup final between Columbus Crew SC and Seattle Sounders FC was held with the lowest attendance in history, 1,500 spectators, due to restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic.
New York City FC won the MLS Cup in 2021 by defeating Portland Timbers in a penalty shootout with a score of 4-2.
Los Angeles FC won their first MLS Cup in 2022 by defeating Philadelphia Union in a penalty shootout with a score of 3-0.
Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup in 2023 by defeating Los Angeles FC with a score of 2-1.
LA Galaxy won their 6th MLS Cup in 2024 by defeating New York Red Bulls with a score of 2-1.
D.C. United has won the MLS Cup 4 times, with their most recent win in 2004.
New England Revolution has appeared in the MLS Cup final 5 times without winning.
LA Galaxy has the most MLS Cup appearances with 10, winning 6 of them.
Dignity Health Sports Park in Carson, California, has hosted the MLS Cup final 7 times, more than any other stadium.
The MLS Cup final was broadcast on MLS Season Pass (Apple) for the first time in 2023.
Philadelphia Union reached the MLS Cup final for the first time in 2022 but did not win.
Real Salt Lake won the MLS Cup in 2009 and has been runners-up once, in 2013.
